channel.title: Reply All
channel.description: "'A podcast about the internet' that is actually an unfailingly original exploration of modern life and how to survive it." - The Guardian. Hosted by PJ Vogt and Alex Goldman, from Gimlet.
channel.itunes:subtitle: "'A podcast about the internet' that is actually an unfailingly original exploration of modern life and how to survive it." - The Guardian. Hosted by PJ Vogt and Alex Goldman, from Gimlet.
channel.itunes:author: Gimlet

item.title: #20 I Want To Break Free
item.description: Yes Yes No returns, and the story of two people who created a company designed to ghostwrite people’s emotionally difficult emails. Don’t forget to participate in Email Debt Forgiveness Day! Leave us a voicemail at (917) 475-6668 about your most anxiety inducing unanswered email. All will be forgiven, we promise.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Yes Yes No returns, and the story of two people w…

Don’t forget to participate in Email Debt Forgiveness Day! Leave us a voicemail at (917) 475-6668 about your most anxiety inducing unanswered email. All will be forgiven, we promise.
item.content:encoded:
Yes Yes No returns, and the story of two people who created a company designed to ghostwrite people’s emotionally difficult emails.

Don’t forget to participate in Email Debt Forgiveness Day! Leave us a voicemail at (917) 475-6668 about your most anxiety inducing unanswered email. All will be forgiven, we promise.

item.title: #19 Underdog
item.description: Marnie the Dog is one of the most famous dogs on Instagram. Two years ago, she was near death at an animal shelter in Connecticut, now she has 1.2 million followers and hangs out with human celebrities.This week, we investigate the formula for internet dog fame, and look at how having a famous dog will completely upend your life. Thanks for listening. Subscribe to the show at www.itunes.com/replyall, or anywhere else you listen to podcasts. Help us with Email Debt Forgiveness Day by telling us about your email anxieties! Leave a voicemail at 1 (917) 475-6668. Also, to see an article about this episode on digg.com with tons more cute dog content, go to http://digg.com/2015/how-a-dog-goes-from-0-to-1-2-million-instagram-followers-in-a-year
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Marnie the Dog is one of the most famous dogs on …

Marnie the Dog is one of the most famous dogs on Instagram. Two years ago, she was near death at an animal shelter in Connecticut, now she has 1.2 million followers and hangs out with human celebrities.This week, we investigate the formula for internet dog fame, and look at how having a famous dog will completely upend your life.

Thanks for listening. Subscribe to the show at www.itunes.com/replyall, or anywhere else you listen to podcasts. Help us with Email Debt Forgiveness Day by telling us about your email anxieties! Leave a voicemail at 1 (917) 475-6668. Also, to see an article about this episode on digg.com with tons more cute dog content, go to http://digg.com/2015/how-a-dog-goes-from-0-to-1-2-million-instagram-followers-in-a-year

item.title: #18 Silence And Respect
item.description: In 2012, a woman named Lindsey Stone posted a picture she took as a joke to her Facebook page. A month later, she was under attack from all corners of the internet, out of a job, hounded by the press. The internet had targeted her for a public shaming. Jon Ronson, journalist and author of the new book "So You've Been Publicly Shamed", walks us through Lindsey's story and introduces us to the sometimes sketchy world of online reputation management.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: In 2012, a woman named Lindsey Stone posted a pic…

Jon Ronson, journalist and author of the new book "So You've Been Publicly Shamed", walks us through Lindsey's story and introduces us to the sometimes sketchy world of online reputation management.

A month later, she was under attack from all corners of the internet, out of a job, hounded by the press. The internet had targeted her for a public shaming. Jon Ronson, journalist and author of the new book "So You've Been Publicly Shamed", walks us through Lindsey's story and introduces us to the sometimes sketchy world of online reputation management.

item.title: #17 The Time Traveler And The Hitman
item.description: In 1997, John Silveira wrote a joke classified ad in a tiny publication called Backwoods Home Magazine asking if anyone wanted to travel back in time with him. A lot of people took him seriously. What do you do when everyone wants you to fix the worst mistakes they've ever made.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: In 1997, John Silveira wrote a joke classified ad…

A lot of people took him seriously. What do you do when everyone wants you to fix the worst mistakes they've ever made.

A lot of people took him seriously. What do you do when everyone wants you to fix the worst mistakes they've ever made.

item.title: #16 Why Is Mason Reese Crying?
item.description: For Jonathan Goldstein, YouTube offers endless nostalgia, but he always finds himself returning to the same subject - a precocious child actor from the early 70’s named Mason Reese. And then a few months ago, new clips of Reese began popping up on YouTube. What's more, they appeared to be uploaded by Reese himself. Jonathan sets out to discover why - and why now, after 40 years.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: For Jonathan Goldstein, YouTube offers endless no…
item.itunes:summary: For Jonathan Goldstein, YouTube offers endless nostalgia, but he always finds himself returning to the same subject - a precocious child actor from the early 70’s named Mason Reese. And then a few months ago, new clips of Reese began popping up on YouTube. What's more, they appeared to be uploaded by Reese himself. Jonathan sets out to discover why - and why now, after 40 years.
item.content:encoded: For Jonathan Goldstein, YouTube offers endless nostalgia, but he always finds himself returning to the same subject - a precocious child actor from the early 70’s named Mason Reese. And then a few months ago, new clips of Reese began popping up on YouTube. What's more, they appeared to be uploaded by Reese himself. Jonathan sets out to discover why - and why now, after 40 years.

item.title: #15 I've Killed People And I Have Hostages
item.description: Blair Myhand is a police officer in the sleepy, 42,000 person town of Apex, NC. One night, he received an unusually disturbing phone call where a person claimed to be holding a woman hostage after murdering several people. Myhand assembled his team, and went to the house, but what they ended up finding was much more bizarre.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Blair Myhand is a police officer in the sleepy, 4…

Myhand assembled his team, and went to the house, but what they ended up finding was much more bizarre.

item.title: #14 The Art of Making and Fixing Mistakes
item.description: A social media mistake for the record books, and a quiet saint of Wikipedia.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: A social media mistake for the record books, and …
item.itunes:summary: A social media mistake for the record books, and a quiet saint of Wikipedia.

item.title: #13 Love is Lies
item.description: A woman starts dating again at 60 after her marriage falls apart. We follow her into a world of millionaire import/export moguls and fifteen-year old internet scammers.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: A woman starts dating again at 60 after her marri…

item.title: #1 - An App Sends A Stranger To Say I Love You (Updated)
item.description: What happens when a woman sends a stocky blond stranger to tell her ex she loves him. (Updated with a new interview!)
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: What happens when a woman sends a stocky blond st…

item.title: #12 Back End Trouble
item.description: The entire internet decides to look at one famous butt at the same time. One man has to ensure that the website hosting Kardashian butt pictures doesn't crash. The sheer terror and joy of solving that problem. (Plus, a new Yes/Yes/No.)
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: The entire internet decides to look at one famous…
item.itunes:summary: The entire internet decides to look at one famous butt at the same time. One man has to ensure that the website hosting Kardashian butt pictures doesn't crash. The sheer terror and joy of solving that problem. (Plus, a new Yes/Yes/No.)

item.title: #11 Did Errol Morris' Brother Invent Email?
item.description: There was a lot that Errol Morris never knew about his brilliant, distant older brother Noel. Decades after Noel's death, Errol read an internet comment that said his brother had invented email. So he launched an investigation to find out if it was true.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: There was a lot that Errol Morris never knew abou…
item.itunes:summary: There was a lot that Errol Morris never knew about his brilliant, distant older brother Noel. Decades after Noel's death, Errol read an internet comment that said his brother had invented email. So he launched an investigation to find out if it was true.

item.title: #10 The French Connection
item.description: In the early 80's, way before the world wide web existed, the French government shipped a $200 terminal to every home with a phone line, and created a service that for decades ran alongside the internet. It was called The Minitel. Producer Carla Green speaks to reporter Jean-Marc Manach, who, in the early 90's, made a living posing as a woman in sex chat rooms on Minitel.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: In the early 80's, way before the world wide web …

It was called The Minitel. Producer Carla Green speaks to reporter Jean-Marc Manach, who, in the early 90's, made a living posing as a woman in sex chat rooms on Minitel.
item.content:encoded: In the early 80's, way before the world wide web existed, the French government shipped a $200 terminal to every home with a phone line, and created a service that for decades ran alongside the internet. It was called The Minitel. Producer Carla Green speaks to reporter Jean-Marc Manach, who, in the early 90's, made a living posing as a woman in sex chat rooms on Minitel.

item.title: #9 The Writing On The Wall
item.description: Yik Yak is a an app that allows users to communicate anonymously with anyone within a 10-mile radius. At Colgate University in upstate New York, the anonymity brought out a particularly vicious strain of racism that shook the school.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Yik Yak is a an app that allows users to communic…
item.itunes:summary: Yik Yak is a an app that allows users to communicate anonymously with anyone within a 10-mile radius. At Colgate University in upstate New York, the anonymity brought out a particularly vicious strain of racism that shook the school.

item.title: #8 Anxiety Box
item.description: Sometimes, on his way to work, a feeling of pressure begins thumping in Paul Ford’s chest. His breaths shorten. They speed up. And sometimes, in those moments of extreme anxiety, Paul’s phone talks to him. It tells him everything that’s wrong with him.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes, on his way to work, a feeling of press…
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes, on his way to work, a feeling of pressure begins thumping in Paul Ford’s chest. His breaths shorten. They speed up. And sometimes, in those moments of extreme anxiety, Paul’s phone talks to him. It tells him everything that’s wrong with him.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes, on his way to work, a feeling of pressure begins thumping in Paul Ford’s chest. His breaths shorten. They speed up. And sometimes, in those moments of extreme anxiety, Paul’s phone talks to him. It tells him everything that’s wrong with him.

item.title: #7 This Website Is For Sale
item.description: This week we enter the mysterious, Byzantine underworld of domain sales, where people make money speculating on the website naming market. A few years ago, the owners of the popular journalism website longform.org blundered into this world when they innocently tried to procure longform.com. In this episode, we find out about their misadventures, and we hear from the Derek Jeter of URL purchases.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: This week we enter the mysterious, Byzantine unde…

In this episode, we find out about their misadventures, and we hear from the Derek Jeter of URL purchases.

In this episode, we find out about their misadventures, and we hear from the Derek Jeter of URL purchases.

item.title: #6 This Proves Everything
item.description: Depending on who you ask, Keith Calder is either a 35-year old film producer, or one of the players in a vast international conspiracy designed to conceal the greatest love story never told.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Depending on who you ask, Keith Calder is either …
item.itunes:summary: Depending on who you ask, Keith Calder is either a 35-year old film producer, or one of the players in a vast international conspiracy designed to conceal the greatest love story never told.

item.title: #5 Jennicam
item.description: In 1996 Jennifer Ringley started Jennicam.org, where she recorded and broadcast her entire life, 24/7. It made her famous. And then, one day, she disappeared from the internet entirely. What'd she figure out about the perils of living publicly before the rest of us did? Alex Goldman tracks her down.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: In 1996 Jennifer Ringley started Jennicam.org, wh…

And then, one day, she disappeared from the internet entirely. What'd she figure out about the perils of living publicly before the rest of us did? Alex Goldman tracks her down.
item.content:encoded: In 1996 Jennifer Ringley started Jennicam.org, where she recorded and broadcast her entire life, 24/7. It made her famous. And then, one day, she disappeared from the internet entirely. What'd she figure out about the perils of living publicly before the rest of us did? Alex Goldman tracks her down.

item.title: #4 Follow The Money
item.description: Writer Chiara Atik has a hobby -- spying on the financial transactions of friends and strangers. She thinks that Venmo, more than any other social media site, is the place you can find actual, accidental truth online. This week we investigate that claim.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Writer Chiara Atik has a hobby -- spying on the f…

item.title: #3 We Know What You Did
item.description: Twenty years ago, Ethan Zuckerman did something terrible on the internet. And he's still living with the consequences.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: Twenty years ago, Ethan Zuckerman did something t…

item.title: #2 The Secret, Gruesome Internet For Doctors
item.description: An app called Figure One wants to be Instagram, but for doctors. Why would doctors need their own Instagram? We spy on the secret & disgusting medical internet, plus we speak to one of its residents.
item.itunes:author: Gimlet
item.itunes:subtitle: An app called Figure One wants to be Instagram, b…
